solution: Let $x,$ $y,$ and $z$ be the areas of $\triangle ADE,$ $\triangle BDC,$ and $\triangle ABD,$ respectively. The area of $\triangle ABE$ is \[\frac 1 2\cdot 4\cdot 8= 16= x+z,\]and the area of $\triangle BAC$ is \[\frac 1 2\cdot 4\cdot 6 = 12= y+z.\]Subtracting these equations gives $$(x+z) - (y+z) = 16-12\implies x - y = \boxed{4}.$$
